comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13

"To display this page, Firefox must send information that will repeat any action (such as a search or order confirmation) that was performed earlier."

I get that code every time I try to refresh a page, try to go from one page to another, load a new game app, anything.  I can not disable it and it is very annoying, and looking thru forums I am not the only one with the problem and it has yet to be fixed or answered.  FYI I am not using the back button or trying to go to a previous page. Mainly using Facebook but it has also given me the code while in my Gmail.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.In all honesty I am not sure how to reproduce the error, it is a consistent and is with my Facebook and my personal Gmail account.
2.
3.


Expected Results:  
We should not be getting the 'resend' error, it should go from page to page or refresh with out an error code.

I have restarted my Firefox Browser, still occurs.  Restarted my pc, still occurs.  Logged out and back in to my Facebook, still occurs.  Logged out and back in to my Gmail, still occurs.  I however do not get the error code when I try Chrome or Internet Explorer.

comments.raw_text:
>In all honesty I am not sure how to reproduce the error, it is a consistent
>and is with my Facebook and my personal Gmail account.

You should describe how you get the error, step by step.
An example: 1) open www.gmail.com 2) Enter login info and submit 3) click on one of the emails in the inbox to open it....
